content.description: A tips to hands crack on the East side of Steve.  From the top of the tower, rap down to the platform and build a gear anchor.  Begin in a twin crack system and bon voyage!  Work through the sugar coated rock and dig your tips and feet into the crack, wishing the foot holds weren't crumbling off beneath you.  The crux is on the bottom half, getting above the large pod.  Has only been TRed off the goodies on top due to a time constraint.
content.protection: Many tips to #3 cams, heavy on the small stuff.  From the top, it measures 36 meters to the dirt, so plan accordingly with a single 80m or double any other ropes.

climbs.name: Mitch's Maddness
climbs.fa: Matt Penrod & Kyran Keisling FA in the 90s.  FFA, Mitch Yaggie, Marilla Lamb, & Roy Suggett

content.description: 5.11 "AWKWARD"  This is pumppy hard work that eats gear and mere mortals!  Very impressive lead!
content.protection: See photo, but bring it ALL especially BD #2s X 4!
content.location: North side of first tower in obvious crack.

content.description: Beautiful colors on the lower section make this line very photogenic.  Move through hand cracks up and left to reach the right facing dihedral. Near the top the looseness will freak you out.  Do not stop at the old anchor (two 1/4" star heads with rusty hangers that might give psychological pro)  but move up and right prior to heading back left to the summit.
content.protection: See photo but bring everything!  Especially tricams and runners.  You will find what you need on top.
